segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching into the cookie jar like he’s on a mission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second, and he doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is standing right there, waiting for him to hand her a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how bold they’re being with the woman right there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing feels like a scene from a cartoon, but it’s happening right in front of me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the light comes through the window makes the whole thing look even more dramatic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a little jealous of their bravery, to be honest.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they don’t get caught, but I also hope they don’t fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s balancing act is impressive, even if it’s reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at their teamwork.
segments.speaker: PAR
